intro: Ruellia longifilamentosa, commonly known as the long filament ruellia, is a species of flowering plant in the Acanthaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Ruellia longifilamentosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and prolonged flowering period.
